sentences: Ta töötas selle projektiga viie aastaks.
Me plaanisime reisi kolmeks aastaks ette.
translation: by the end of the year
context: The Estonian word 'aastaks' is an elative case form of the word 'aasta' (year). It indicates movement away from within the concept of time, often translated as 'for a year,' 'by the end of the year,' or 'within a year.' In grammar terms, it's in the elative case which typically expresses separation or origin. When used with verbs of motion, it can indicate completion or duration over a specific timeframe.
